ygData.subject: Re: [The EverQuest Tavern] In response to the Plea for help
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Everquest is a subliminal addiction, just like certain people setting all things aside for football... on a much lesser scale of course because quite
ygData.messageBody:
> http://everquest.allakhazam.com/news/sdetail1142.html?story=1142
>
> In my experience, anyone who would be so afflicted by
> the outcome of a game is not a terribly stable person
> in the first place. Everquest has actually helped me
> save money for tuition, and has kept me out of trouble
> as well. I sit at home and play EverQuest for a few
> hours every night. With a starting cost of 9.95 for
> the game, 12.95 a month for a pre-paid card (I hate
> credit cards), I get the first month free, 19.99 a
> month in internet services (which I would have anyway)


Everquest is a subliminal addiction, just like certain people setting
all things aside for football... on a much lesser scale of course
because quite frank, there is absolutely no redeeming value of
dedicating one's entire time and achieving something in a video game
besides personal satisfaction (unless it's some godawful tournament
which I can't ****ing stand). It all depends on the individual.
Certain people can set rigid guidelines for themselves (play for a
certain number of hours) and abide by them, and some people can't.

Here's another link:

http://www.etonline.com/television/a12770.htm

Digital
